channel.title: How do you move the train objects
channel.description: how do you move stuff like the dummys or bones somewhere else. help plz

item.description:
@doggiedoo86 wrote:

To answer your question you add a object.

item.source: How do you move the train objects

item.title: How do you move the train objects
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

[quote=“krixus, post:6, topic:152595”]I have this:

public void NewObjects() {//X Y ID DIR 10 (Dir, 0=West -1=North -2=East -3=South) AddGlobalObject(3033, 9558, 2038, -2, 10);//dummy @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3034, 9558, 2038, -2, 10);//dummy @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3035, 9558, 377, -2, 10);//chest @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3036, 9558, 377, -2, 10);//chest @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3032, 9557, 299, -1, 10);//hay @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3030, 9556, 299, 0, 10);//hay @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3039, 9554, 380, -2, 10);//bookcase @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3037, 9557, 2513, -2, 10);//target @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3038, 9556, 2513, -1, 10);//target @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3038, 9553, 10726, -1, 10);//bones @ lair train

So just search for AddGlobalObject( until you find the Object ID you wanna change.

Just change it to how you want.[/quote]

The first number is the X-postion. The second nyumber is the Y-Position, the third number is the object ID. The fourth number is the direction the object faces. The last number is the ground height.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you move the train objects

item.title: How do you move the train objects
item.dc:creator: @krixus krixus
item.description:
@krixus wrote:

I have this:

public void NewObjects() {//X Y ID DIR 10 (Dir, 0=West -1=North -2=East -3=South) AddGlobalObject(3033, 9558, 2038, -2, 10);//dummy @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3034, 9558, 2038, -2, 10);//dummy @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3035, 9558, 377, -2, 10);//chest @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3036, 9558, 377, -2, 10);//chest @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3032, 9557, 299, -1, 10);//hay @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3030, 9556, 299, 0, 10);//hay @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3039, 9554, 380, -2, 10);//bookcase @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3037, 9557, 2513, -2, 10);//target @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3038, 9556, 2513, -1, 10);//target @ lair train AddGlobalObject(3038, 9553, 10726, -1, 10);//bones @ lair train

So just search for AddGlobalObject( until you find the Object ID you wanna change.

Just change it to how you want.

Read full topic
